rename.from: Scaffold ignores system's comma separator for HasDefaultValue
rename.to: Scaffold uses system's comma separator for HasDefaultValue

body: Please share the full CREATE  TABLE statement

I created a minimal example

```
USE [BIS]
GO

SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO

SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[Foo](
	[id] [int] IDENTITY(1,1) NOT NULL,	
	[weight] [float] NOT NULL,	
 CONSTRAINT [PK_Foo] PRIMARY KEY CLUSTERED 
(
	[id] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, IGNORE_DUP_KEY = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON) ON [PRIMARY])
GO

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[Foo] ADD  CONSTRAINT [DF_Foo_weight]  DEFAULT ((1.0)) FOR [weight]
GO
```


```
        modelBuilder.Entity<Foo>(entity =>
        {
            entity.Property(e => e.Weight).HasDefaultValue(10.0);
        });
```

```
[Table("Foo")]
public partial class Foo
{
    [Key]
    [Column("id")]
    public int Id { get; set; }

    [Column("weight")]
    public double Weight { get; set; }
}
```

> @roji Happy to submit a PR!

Sure, that'd be great!

issue.title: Scaffold not using CLR types for default values

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
### Bug description

When scaffolding an existing database using `dotnet ef dbcontext scaffold`, depending on the current culture, the default values are not recognized as CLR types and `HasDefaultValueSql` is used instead of `HasDefaultValue`.

### Running with `fr-FR` culture (reproduces the issue):

Powershell steps:

```powershell
PS > [cultureinfo]::CurrentCulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1036             fr-FR            French (France)


PS > [cultureinfo]::CurrentUICulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1033             en-US            English (United States)


PS > dotnet ef dbcontext scaffold "***" Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer
```

Generated code:

```csharp
    protected override void OnModelCreating(ModelBuilder modelBuilder)
    {
        modelBuilder.UseCollation("Latin1_General_CI_AS");

        modelBuilder.Entity<TestTable>(entity =>
        {
            entity
                .HasNoKey()
                .ToTable("TestTable");

            entity.Property(e => e.TestColumn)
                .HasDefaultValueSql("((12.34))")
                .HasColumnType("decimal(18, 0)");
        });

        OnModelCreatingPartial(modelBuilder);
    }
```

### Running with `en-US` culture (does not reproduce the issue):

```powershell
PS > [cultureinfo]::CurrentCulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1033             en-US            English (United States)


PS > [cultureinfo]::CurrentUICulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1033             en-US            English (United States)


PS > dotnet ef dbcontext scaffold "***" Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer
```

Generated code:

```csharp
    protected override void OnModelCreating(ModelBuilder modelBuilder)
    {
        modelBuilder.UseCollation("Latin1_General_CI_AS");

        modelBuilder.Entity<TestTable>(entity =>
        {
            entity
                .HasNoKey()
                .ToTable("TestTable");

            entity.Property(e => e.TestColumn)
                .HasDefaultValue(12.34m)
                .HasColumnType("decimal(18, 0)");
        });

        OnModelCreatingPartial(modelBuilder);
    }
```

### Your code

```csharp
Database collation: `Latin1_General_CI_AS`


SET ANSI_NULLS ON
GO

SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON
GO

CREATE TABLE [dbo].[TestTable](
	[TestColumn] [decimal](18, 0) NOT NULL
) ON [PRIMARY]
GO

ALTER TABLE [dbo].[TestTable] ADD  CONSTRAINT [DF_TestTable_TestColumn]  DEFAULT ((12.34)) FOR [TestColumn]
GO
```

### EF Core version

9.0.2

### Database provider

Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.SqlServer

### Target framework

net9.0

### Operating system

Windows 11

### IDE

N/A
